newsitem.title: ITALY: Italian union chief sees car scheme helping output.
newsitem.headline: Italian union chief sees car scheme helping output.

text.p: A top union leader said on Tuesday that industrial production in February and March should receive a boost from a government car incentives scheme introduced at the end of last year.
"In February and March the measures taken by the government at the end of 1996, among them the car incentive scheme, should take some effect," Sergio Cofferati told a news conference.

Figures released by national statistics institute Istat on Tuesday showed industrial production falling 6.4 percent year-on-year in January but rising a seasonally adjusted 0.4 percent from the previous month.
The car incentives scheme offers government cash to those trading in a car more than 10 years old for a new one.
Cofferati said the output data "entirely confirm our worries ... the slowdown in growth can put at risk existing jobs."
